intro: Calycothrix granulosa, commonly known as the granular calyx plant, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, annual growth habit and is native to parts of southern Africa. The plant features a basal rosette of leaves that are usually hairy and have a granular texture. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Calycothrix granulosa is often found in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments.
